QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Look at this series: 14, 28, 20, 40, 32, 64, ... What number should come next?
If a person walks at 14 km/hr instead of 10 km/hr, he would have walked 20 km more. The actual distance travelled by him is:
The average of 20 numbers is zero. Of them, at the most, how many may be greater than zero?
A, P, R, X, S and Z are sitting in a row. S and Z are in the centre. A and P are at the ends. R is sitting to the left of A. Who is to the right of P ?

There are 8 houses in a line and in each house only one boy lives with the conditions as given below: 1. Jack is not the neighbour Siman. 2. Harry is just next to the left of Larry. 3. There is at least one to the left of Larry. 4. Paul lives in one of the two houses in the middle. 5. Mike lives in between Paul and Larry. If at least one lives to the right of Robert and Harry is not between Taud and Larry, then which one of the following statement is not correct ?

OPTIONS.OPTION: Robert is not at the left end.
Robert is in between Simon and Taud.
Taud is in between Paul and Jack.
There are three persons to the right of Paul.

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Correct sequence of time delays that happen during a data trasfer from a disk to memory is :

OPTIONS.OPTION: seek time, latency time and tranfer time
seek time, access time and tranfer time
latency time, seek time and tranfer time
latency time, access time and tranfer time

OPTIONS.OPTION: It makes implementation of lexical and syntax analysis easier
Syntax-directed translations can be written for intermediate code generation
It enhances the portability of the front-end of the compiler
It is not possible to generate code for real machines directly from high level language programs

OPTIONS.OPTION: it entirely depends on the language
when efficient use of computer time is the considerarion

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: In a time sharing operating system, when the time slot given to a process is completed, the process from the RUNNING state goes to which state?
A computer system has 6 tape drives, with p process competing for them. Each process may need upto 3 tape drives. The maximum value of 'p', for which the system is GUARANTEED to be deadlock free is :
Semaphores are used to solve the problem of :
What is meant by timeslicing?

OPTIONS.OPTION: Timeslicing is the method of de-allocating CPU time to individual threads in a priority schedule.
Timeslicing is the method of allocating CPU space to individual threads in a priority schedule.
Timeslicing is the method of allocating CPU time to individual threads in a priority schedule.
Timeslicing is the method of de-allocating CPU space to individual threads in a priority schedule.

Which statement about database views is true?

OPTIONS.OPTION: A view can have ORDER BY and GROUP BY clauses in the SELECT statement.
A view cannot have an ORDER BY clause in the SELECT statement.
A view cannot be created with a GROUP BY clause in the SELECT statement.
A view must have aliases defined for the column names in the SELECT statement.

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Examine the structure of the EMPLOYEES table: EMPLOYEE_ID NUMBER Primary Key FIRST_NAME VARCHAR2 (25) LAST_NAME VARCHAR2 (25) Which statement will insert a row into the table?

Examine the description of the EMPLOYEES table: EMP_ID NUMBER(4) NOT NULL LAST_NAME VARCHAR2(30) NOT NULL FIRST_NAME VARCHAR2(30) DEPT_ID NUMBER(2) JOB_CAT VARCHARD2(30) SALARY NUMBER(8,2) Which statement shows the maximum salary paid in each job category of each department?

OPTIONS.OPTION: SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees WHERE salary > MAX(salary);
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY dept_id, job_cat;
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees;
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY dept_id;

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: The employee information in a company is stored in the relation Employee (name, sex, salary, deptName) Consider the following SQL query Select deptName From Employee Where sex = 'M' Group by deptName Having avg(salary) > (select avg (salary) from Employee); It returns the names of the department in which

OPTIONS.OPTION: the average salary is more than the average salary in the company
the average salary of male employees is more than the average salary of all male employees in the company
the average salary of male employees is more than the average salary of employees in the same department.
the average salary of male employees is more than the average salary in the company

Disks are more reliable than memory
